title.narrative: Emergency rapid response for women, men, boys and girls affected by conflicts induced displacements and natural disasters in Kachin State

description.narrative:
In response to the growing humanitarian needs in Kachin State, occasioned by the distinct increase in conflict-induced internally displaced populations since November 2016, SI proposes to extend its existing rapid response mechanism and provide immediate assistance to people affected by conflict and natural disasters. This response shall reach a minimum of 5,750 individuals in Kachin State State (2,056 women, 1,682 men, 2,012 girls and boys, 115 disabled persons), with an expanded package of emergency WASH, and NFI Emergency Shelter interventions. SI will keep its capacity to meet basic needs in Government Controlled and Non-Controlled Areas (GCA/NGCA), being flexible in the modality of assistance (in-kind or cash).
The project includes three main components:
1. Rapid Response Mechanism Emergency access to safe water via a wide range of technical options, along with constant water quality monitoring. Provision of sanitation facilities in emergency. Provision of hygiene kits with a focus on providing messaging on risks related to acute watery diarrhea. Provision of emergency shelter and NFIs to ensure improved quality of life of beneficiaries. Unconditional limited cash distribution to address the most urgent needs not covered by standardized assistance.
2. Fill highest priority gaps in protracted crisis situation The project aims to rapidly cover basic WASH gaps prioritizing the provision of safe water and construction/rehabilitation of semi-permanent sanitation infrastructures. High priority locations cited by the WASH cluster will be targeted.
3. Capacity building of local NGOs SI will duplicate emergency response trainings that will remain open to humanitarian agencies staff as well as to local authorities (RDD, DRD, DRSW...). The courses are focused on MIRA and design of emergency response in a various range of sectors.
Gender is taken into consideration throughout the proposed project design by prioritizing the most vulnerable, i.e women-headed households, the elderly, the disabled and the chronically ill an accountability mechanism will especially make sure that the voices of these categories of beneficiaries are heard.
SI will rely on its rapid response team to coordinate interventions, designed to reach the remote areas in order to deliver response in a timely manner. The team will initiate multi-sector rapid assessment and response for any emergency declared: IDP displacement, natural disasters, influx of returnees, etc. SI will also rely on local partners and networks when there is a need to facilitate access to NGCA. Because of the random nature of emergency, SI will set up ad-hoc partnerships for specific interventions where required.
